data.title: France says it has proof Assad carried out chemical attack that killed 86
Scientists say the Great Barrier Reef is officially dying
Exxon Mobil has reportedly applied for a waiver to work in Russia

Giraffes must be listed as endangered, conservationists formally tell US - Environmental groups point to ‘trophy’ hunting – largely by Americans who travel to Africa. Americans imported 21,402 bone carvings, 3,008 skin pieces & 3,744 hunting trophies from giraffes in last decade.

A Russian journalist known for his criticism of President Vladimir Putin has died after being beaten by unknown attackers, it has been reported. Nikolai Andrushchenko, 73, who co-founded the Novy Peterburg newspaper, was attacked six weeks ago and had been in a coma since then.
Turkey: Videos show electoral fraud and ballot stuffing
‘Armada’ Trump claimed was deployed to North Korea actually heading to Australia - 'We are sending an armada. Very powerful. We have submarines. Very powerful,' Mr Trump said last week
Poachers kill 20,000 reindeer to harvest their tongues, causing a massive drop in their population
Russia drafts bill to block anonymizers and VPN services
